data.text:
I got an Archos 5 Android, plays h.264 mp4s very well.

Tried these:

Media coder (everything I want, but doesn't always output right)

AVS video converter (slows to a crawl and stops using any cpu near the end of the file..)

Wondershare video converter (can't read ass subs embedded in MKV files)

xilisoft

I also tried megui, but it was more of an awkward messing around, I understand most settings in mediacoder but megui is way too technical for me.

Do you guys know anything that is as good as mediacoder, that is reliable?

Handbrake

just avoid MP3 audio, i've found it goes out of sync sometimes (ogg works fine)

I've tried it, works perfect besides inability to read softsubs in mkv. It's nice, can't wait for automatic batch conversion so don't have to add stuff one by one.

When you say mp3 audio, do you mean input or output?

I usually use Yamb, TMPEGEnc, and even Nero Vision. I've also used 3GP2AVI. I've even used VLC a few times, it's a powerful transcoder if you can figure out what works best together.

For FFMpeg I like using WinFF, it's kinda like Yamb.
